column4: you can set your router to any MAC address and the internet service provider would never see that address, it's your intranet not internet. just saying they might not accept that as an excuse to do what you ask
though not being about to connect they may just work with you either way
if the modem is in bridged and no router mode, the ISP will definitely see the MAC address of any interface connected to it
that still has nothing to do with what the ISP sees, they only see the MAC of your modem
